headline.main: May 3, 1971 | Mayday Tribe Holds Antiwar Demonstration

docs.abstract: On May 3, 1971, police clashed with anti-war protesters who called themselves "the Mayday Tribe," and had staged three days of demonstrations in Washington, D.C., aimed at shutting down the nation's capital.
docs.snippet: On May 3, 1971, police clashed with anti-war protesters who called themselves "the Mayday Tribe," and had staged three days of demonstrations in Washington, D.C., aimed at shutting down the nation's capital.

docs.lead_paragraph: United States authorities have charged 107 people, including doctors and nurses, for trying to defraud the federal Medicare health care program for the elderly and disabled of about $452 million.

headline.main: More Than 100 Are Charged in Medicare Fraud Sweep
headline.print_headline: More Than 100 Are Charged In Medicare Fraud Sweep

docs.snippet: United States authorities have charged 107 people, including doctors and nurses, for trying to defraud the federal Medicare health care program for the elderly and disabled of about $452 million.

docs.lead_paragraph: If you are proactive against germs and plan for emergencies, you can protect your health when you travel.

headline.seo: Fighting Illness and Germs on the Road
headline.main: Your Road Buddies: Zillions of Germs
headline.print_headline: Your Road Buddies: Zillions of Germs

docs.abstract: Business travelers can avoid becoming sick from frequent trips if they follow some proactive tips to protect against germs; those who do get sick can mitigate the damage to themselves and their travels with proper planning.
docs.snippet: If you are proactive against germs and plan for emergencies, you can protect your health when you travel.

docs.lead_paragraph: Jonathan Toubin, a Brooklyn D.J., is back spinning records, less than five months after a bizarre accident left him close to death in Portland, Ore.

headline.seo: A D.J. Recovers From a Nearly Fatal Accident on Tour
headline.main: Back Spinning, After the World Stopped
headline.print_headline: Back Spinning, After the World Stopped

docs.abstract: Brooklyn DJ Jonathan Toubin was badly injured in December 2011 when a taxi crashed through the wall of his hotel room in Portland, Ore; after months of recovery and physical therapy he is once again hosting dance parties around New York City.
docs.snippet: Jonathan Toubin, a Brooklyn D.J., is back spinning records, less than five months after a bizarre accident left him close to death in Portland, Ore.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States is similar to developing countries in the percentage of mothers who give birth before their child is due, according to the World Health Organization and other agencies.

headline.seo: U.S. Lags in Global Measure of Premature Births
headline.main: U.S. Lags in Global Measure of Premature Births
headline.print_headline: U.S. Fares Badly In Early Births In Global Study

docs.abstract: World Health Organization and other agencies, in first country-by-country comparison of premature births, say although American hospitals excel at saving premature infants, the United States is similar to developing countries in the percentage of mothers who give birth before their due date; US does worse on this score than any Western European country and considerably worse than Japan or the Scandinavian countries.
docs.snippet: The United States is similar to developing countries in the percentage of mothers who give birth before their child is due, according to the World Health Organization and other agencies.

docs.lead_paragraph: Staff members had tried to prepare for the impact of a tabloid newspaper article about John Edwards’s extramarital affair, one former aide testified.

headline.seo: Edwards Aide Says Relationship Concerned Him
headline.main: Former Edwards Aides Tell of Affair’s Impact on Wife and Campaign
headline.print_headline: Former Edwards Aides Tell of Affair’s Impact on Wife and Campaign

docs.abstract: Former campaign aides Elizabeth Christina Reynolds and Josh Brumberger take the stand in the federal trial of John Edwards; describe the devastated reaction of Elizabeth Edwards, following a National Inquirer article describing her husband's extramarital affair.
docs.snippet: Staff members had tried to prepare for the impact of a tabloid newspaper article about John Edwards’s extramarital affair, one former aide testified.
Noteworthy cultural events taking place in New York.

docs.lead_paragraph: A major new rule that has drawn the ire of Wall Street is on track for completion sooner than some bankers had expected, dashing the hopes of financial industry lobbyists, who have pressed for a delay. Regulators are making significant progress on a final draft of the regulation, the Volcker Rule, and some officials expected to complete it by September and possibly as early as this summer, people with direct knowledge of the matter said. The people, who spoke on the condition of anonymity, cautioned that regulators have not set a firm date for completing the rule.

headline.main: Progress Is Seen in Advancing a Final Volcker Rule

docs.abstract: Regulators are making significant progress on a final draft of the Volcker Rule, part of the Dodd-Frank financial overhaul bill, and some officials expect to complete it by September or earlier, despite lobbyists' efforts to delay it; regulation aims to rein in risky trading on Wall Street, banning banks from placing bets with their own money, a practice known as proprietary trading. Photos (M)
docs.snippet: A major new rule that has drawn the ire of Wall Street is on track for completion sooner than some bankers had expected, dashing the hopes of financial industry lobbyists, who have pressed for a delay.     Regulators are making significant progress...

headline.main: Prescriptions for Opioid Painkillers Climb in City

docs.abstract: A city task force reported a 22 percent increase in two years and called for legislation to better track prescriptions, with the goal of preventing drug abuse.
docs.snippet: A city task force reported a 22 percent increase in two years and called for legislation to better track prescriptions, with the goal of preventing drug abuse.
